subject: Philosophy
title: Aristotle's Four Causes
description: A 60-second lesson on Aristotle's Four Causes.

hook.text: Why does a statue exist? Aristotle said you need four different answers to fully explain it.

buildup.text: Material cause: marble. Formal cause: its shape. Efficient cause: the sculptor. Final cause: its purpose.

discovery.text: Everything in nature has four causes. Understanding all four means understanding the thing completely.

twist.text: Modern science dropped the final cause. It asks 'how' but not 'what for.' Aristotle would say that's a mistake.

climax.text: The four causes are a framework for complete explanation. They still shape how we think about purpose and design.

punchline.text: One thing. Four questions. Only then do you understand.

quiz.question: What is Aristotle's 'final cause'?
options: The purpose or goal for which something exists
The last event in a sequence
The material something is made of
